bill_title: limit the authority of certain institutions of higher education to regulate the possession of guns by students on campus.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to limit the authority of certain institutions of higher education to regulate the possession of guns by students on campus. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. No public institution of higher education is authorized to do any of the following: (1) Establish rules, regulations, or any code of conduct limiting or abridging the ability of any person to carry or possess a firearm in accordance with state law; (2) Expel, dismiss, or penalize any person who legally carries or possesses a firearm; (3) Require from any student as a condition of enrollment, or from any faculty member as a condition of employment, any waiver limiting or abridging the ability of any person to legally carry or possess a firearm; (4) Prohibit any student who is lawfully allowed to possess a handgun from doing so in dormitory or residence leased to the student; (5) Establish any policy requiring students living in a dormitory or residence to live in a specific unit or complex, or assign or lease housing or dormitory units based on a student's firearms ownership status; (6) Require any student to store a firearm outside his or her dormitory unit; (7) Inquire to any student about his or her firearms ownership status. However, any public institution of higher education may establish rules or regulations relating to the storage of firearms in campus dormitories as long as such rules and regulations do not violate this section. Section 2. For the purposes of this Act only, public institution of higher education, means any public postsecondary educational institution under the Board of Regents or any public postsecondary technical institute under the Board of Education.

action_log.status_text: First read in Senate and referred to
